items.description: Repo is cloned and compose.yaml present at project root.
items.expected: `compose.yaml` exists; `django/` and `web/` directories present.
items.details:
Verify files exist:
  ls -la | grep -E 'compose.yaml' ;  test -f compose.yaml  && echo 'compose.yaml OK' ;  test -d django && echo 'django/ OK' ;  test -d web && echo 'web/ OK'  Optional sanity:
  git status --porcelain
  head -n 20 compose.yaml

items.test: Seed node_modules with npm install (first run)
items.description: Install web dependencies into the named volume using npm install (dev flow).
items.expected: `docker compose --profile dev run --rm web npm install` completes with no fatal errors and may update package-lock.json.
items.details:
Run:
  docker compose --profile dev run --rm web npm install
Check that node_modules is populated:
  docker compose run --rm web ls -1 node_modules | head
Check for updated lockfile:
  git status package-lock.json

items.test: Seed node_modules with npm ci (reproducible build)
items.description: Install web dependencies into the named volume using npm ci (CI/CD flow).
items.expected: `docker compose --profile dev run --rm web npm ci` completes with no fatal errors and exactly matches package-lock.json.
items.details:
Run:
  docker compose --profile dev run --rm web npm ci
Verify node_modules populated:
  docker compose run --rm web ls -1 node_modules | head
Check volume is present:
  docker volume ls | grep django-ml_web_node_modules

items.description: Build django, web, and pull postgres image.
items.expected: `docker compose --profile dev up --build` completes; images `django-ml-django`, `django-ml-web`, and `postgres:16` are used/created.
items.details:
Build and start in background:
  docker compose --profile dev up -d --build
Confirm images present:
  docker images | grep -E 'django-ml-(django|web)'
  docker images | grep 'postgres\s*16'
Confirm containers created:
  docker compose --profile dev ps

items.expected: `docker compose ps` shows django-ml-api, django-ml-web, and db running (or up).
items.details:
Check container state:
  docker compose --profile dev ps
Ports bound on host:
  ss -lntp | grep -E ':8001|:8080' || true
Quick endpoint checks:
  curl -sS http://localhost:8001/health || true
  curl -sS -I http://localhost:8080 || true
Logs (brief):
  docker compose logs --no-color --tail=50 django
  docker compose logs --no-color --tail=50 web

items.expected: GET http://localhost:8080/welcome returns 200 and HTML with 'Welcome'.
items.details:
HTTP status and content:
  curl -i http://localhost:8080/welcome | head -n 20
  curl -s http://localhost:8080/welcome | grep -i 'welcome'
Container logs while hitting page (separate terminal):
  docker compose logs -f web

items.test: Hello from backend on home page
items.expected: GET http://localhost:8080 shows text like 'Hello from Django (service: django)'.
items.details:
Hit home page:
  curl -sS http://localhost:8080 | grep -Ei 'hello.*django' || echo 'If client-side render, open in browser to verify.'
Alternatively hit the same backend API the page calls:
  curl -sS http://localhost:8001/api/hello
Verify web can reach backend from inside web container:
  docker compose exec web curl -sS http://django:8000/api/hello

items.description: Check that username/password form is rendered.
items.expected: Form fields and submit button visible; POST goes to /api/login.
items.details:
Check static HTML (might be minimal if client-side rendered):
  curl -sS http://localhost:8080/login | grep -Ei '(username|password|<form)'
If JS-driven, open browser:
  xdg-open http://localhost:8080/login
Confirm form target (view source):
  curl -sS http://localhost:8080/login | grep -E 'action=|/api/login' || echo 'Check in browser DevTools > Network'

items.expected: GET http://localhost:8001/health returns 200 and `{ "status": "ok" }`.
items.details:
Status + body:
  curl -i http://localhost:8001/health
  curl -s http://localhost:8001/health | jq . || curl -s http://localhost:8001/health

items.expected: GET http://localhost:8001/api/hello returns 200 and `{ "service": "django", "message": "Hello from Django" }`.
items.details:
Status + body:
  curl -i http://localhost:8001/api/hello
  curl -s http://localhost:8001/api/hello | jq . || curl -s http://localhost:8001/api/hello

items.description: Create or ensure a Django user exists.
items.expected: `python manage.py createsuperuser` (or existing user) available for login.
items.details:
Non-interactive superuser (recommended):
  docker compose exec -e DJANGO_SUPERUSER_USERNAME=admin \
    -e DJANGO_SUPERUSER_EMAIL=admin@example.com \
    -e DJANGO_SUPERUSER_PASSWORD=admin django \
    python manage.py createsuperuser --noinput || true
Verify user exists via Django shell:
  docker compose exec django python - <<'PY'
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model
User=get_user_model()
print('admin exists:', User.objects.filter(username='admin').exists())
PY

items.expected: POST http://localhost:8001/api/auth/login with JSON `{ "username":"u","password":"p" }` returns 200 and `{ access, refresh }`.
items.details:
Login with curl:
  curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/auth/login \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -d '{"username":"admin","password":"admin"}' | tee /tmp/jwt.json
Extract access token (jq optional):
  ACCESS=$(jq -r .access /tmp/jwt.json 2>/dev/null || python3 - <<'PY'
import json,sys;print(json.load(open('/tmp/jwt.json')).get('access',''))
PY
)
  echo "ACCESS len: ${#ACCESS}"
Expect non-empty token.

items.expected: GET http://localhost:8001/api/me with `Authorization: Bearer <access>` returns 200 and user payload JSON.
items.details:
Use token from previous step:
  curl -sS http://localhost:8001/api/me -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS" | jq . || curl -sS http://localhost:8001/api/me -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS"

items.expected: `postgresql://app:app@db:5432/app` is set; container logs show successful connection.
items.details:
Check env inside django container:
  docker compose exec django printenv | grep ^DATABASE_URL=
Check logs for connection OK/migrations:
  docker compose logs django | grep -Ei 'Connected|migrate|Applying' || true
Verify Django can open DB:
  docker compose exec django python - <<'PY'
import psycopg2,os
print('DB URL:', os.environ.get('DATABASE_URL',''))
PY || echo 'psycopg2 not installed test skipped'

items.expected: `python manage.py showmigrations` shows built-ins applied; `\dt` in psql lists tables incl. django_migrations.
items.details:
Show migrations:
  docker compose exec django python manage.py showmigrations | sed -n '1,120p'
Check tables in Postgres:
  docker compose exec db psql -U app -d app -c '\dt' | grep django_migrations

items.description: Create a user and verify it exists in DB.
items.expected: User appears in `auth_user` (via Django admin/dbshell).
items.details:
Create a normal user via Django shell:
  docker compose exec django python - <<'PY'
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model
User=get_user_model()
User.objects.update_or_create(username='smoke', defaults={'email':'smoke@example.com'})
print('ok')
PY
Verify via SQL:
  docker compose exec db psql -U app -d app -c "SELECT username,email FROM auth_user WHERE username='smoke';"

items.description: Bring stack down and up again.
items.expected: `docker compose down` then `docker compose up -d`; containers start cleanly.
items.details:
Restart stack:
  docker compose down
  docker compose --profile dev up -d
Verify status:
  docker compose ps
Check quick health:
  curl -sS http://localhost:8001/health && echo
  curl -sS -I http://localhost:8080 | head -n 1

items.description: Verify previously created user still exists.
items.expected: Auth user remains present; volume `django-ml_db_data` persisted data.
items.details:
Confirm volume exists:
  docker volume ls | grep django-ml_db_data
Check user still present:
  docker compose exec db psql -U app -d app -c "SELECT username FROM auth_user WHERE username IN ('admin','smoke');"

items.expected: GET /welcome (8080), GET /api/hello (8001) both 200; login flow still works.
items.details:
Web endpoints:
  curl -sS -o /dev/null -w '%{http_code}\n' http://localhost:8080/welcome
  curl -sS http://localhost:8080 | head -n 1
API endpoints:
  curl -sS http://localhost:8001/api/hello | jq . || curl -sS http://localhost:8001/api/hello
JWT re-check (optional):
  curl -sS -X POST http://localhost:8001/api/auth/login -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"username":"admin","password":"admin"}' | jq . || true

items.description: Follow logs to catch errors during dev.
items.expected: `docker compose logs -f django` and `-f web` show no repeated stack traces.
items.details:
Follow logs in two terminals:
  docker compose logs -f django
  docker compose logs -f web
Look for errors:
  docker compose logs --no-color web | grep -Ei 'error|exception|EADDRINUSE' || true

items.expected: `docker volume ls` includes `django-ml_db_data` and `django-ml_web_node_modules`.
items.details:
List volumes:
  docker volume ls | grep -E 'django-ml_db_data|django-ml_web_node_modules'
Inspect (optional):
  docker volume inspect django-ml_db_data | head -n 20
  docker volume inspect django-ml_web_node_modules | head -n 20

items.expected: `docker compose build --no-cache` succeeds; stack still runs.
items.details:
Stop stack:
  docker compose down
Rebuild:
  docker compose --profile dev build --no-cache
Start:
  docker compose --profile dev up -d
Verify:
  docker compose ps
  curl -sS http://localhost:8001/health && echo OK || true
